text: Say I'm working with rational numbers, with a known bound on the denominator (i.e. all can be written as n/K for some known integer K), how much slower is it to work with Rational{Int} rather than Int ?

elements.text: Say I'm working with rational numbers, with a known bound on the denominator (i.e. all can be written as n/K for some known integer K), how much slower is it to work with Rational{Int} rather than Int ?

text: Probably 2-5x. If you want the performance, you could make a zero overhead fixed denominator type

elements.text: Probably 2-5x. If you want the performance, you could make a zero overhead fixed denominator type

text: OK, thanks! for now I think I'll just use `Int`s and store the denominator close by. Do you have `struct FixedDenomRational{denom} num::Int end`  in mind?
